content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's the function `extract_julia_code`: ```javascript function extract_julia_code(md: String) # Remove HTML code fences and join all code blocks together with a newline result = "" for line in md.split("\n") if match(r"", line) continue end if match(r"(?m|
)([ \t\r]+)
", line) strip_indent = (line:match(r"\s+"), "\n")[1] while strip_indent and strip_indent[0] == " ": strip_indent = strip_indent[1:] end result += strip_indent + codeblock(line:match(r"")) + "\n" elseif match(r"(?m|)([ \t\r]+)", line) strip_indent = (line:match(r"\s+"), "\n")[1] while strip_indent and strip_indent[0] == " ": strip_indent = strip_indent[1:] end result += strip_indent + codeblock(line:match(r"")) + "\n" else result += line end end return result end ``` This function works by splitting the input markdown `md` into lines and then iterating through them. If a line contains an HTML code fence, it skips that line. Otherwise, if there is a preformatted or code block starting on the current line, it extracts its contents and adds them to the result string along with their surrounding whitespace. It also handles any other text content in each line as usual. Finally, it joins all code blocks together with newlines between them.
